snippet: New York is to pay $15 million in a class-action suit challenging arrests for loitering that were based on laws that had been ruled unconstitutional.
abstract: Federal Judge Shira A Scheindlin approves a class-action settlement in a suit filed over illegal arrests for loitering in New York City; agreement includes a $15 million payment by the city and an unusual promise that officials will work to expunge thousands of convictions; between 1983 and 1993, federal and state courts struck down laws banning loitering to panhandle or search for a sex partner as unconstitutional, but some 22,000 people were charged with the offenses following the rulings.
lead_paragraph: New York is to pay $15 million in a class-action suit challenging arrests for loitering that were based on laws that had been ruled unconstitutional.

headline.seo: New York Settles Suit on Illegal Arrests for Loitering
headline.main: Long Fight Ends Over Arrests for Loitering
